intro: Angiopteris forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four parts, resembling a water lily. This plant is native to freshwater habitats in Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. Angiopteris forbesii thrives in still or slow-moving waters with abundant sunlight. Its delicate structure and ability to spread through vegetative reproduction make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
